long_desc.thetext:
Upstream released an advisory [1] which fixes XSS issue in Drupal 7 Date module.

[1]: https://www.drupal.org/node/2312609

Created drupal7-date tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1125284]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1125285]
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Hi!

Can we close this issue? It's fixed in drupal7-date 2.8 and pushed it to stable repositories.

(In reply to Peter Borsa from comment #6)
> Hi!
> 
> Can we close this issue? It's fixed in drupal7-date 2.8 and pushed it to
> stable repositories.

Sure, this is now CLOSED/ERRATA.

Upstream released an advisory [1] which fixes XSS issue in Drupal 7 Date module.

[1]: https://www.drupal.org/node/2312609

Created drupal7-date tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1125284]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1125285]
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Hi!

Can we close this issue? It's fixed in drupal7-date 2.8 and pushed it to stable repositories.

(In reply to Peter Borsa from comment #6)
> Hi!
> 
> Can we close this issue? It's fixed in drupal7-date 2.8 and pushed it to
> stable repositories.

Sure, this is now CLOSED/ERRATA.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1125283,1125285

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2014-5169

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link instead:

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1125283,1125285

drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6

drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5

Package drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-2084/drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by jsmith.
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 testing updates repository.
This update has been pushed to testing
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by jsmith.
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable updates repository.
This update has been pushed to stable

notes: Update to upstream 2.8 release due to security update for CVE-2014-5169
title: drupal7-date-2.8-1.el5
